result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary W. Mckusick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Unpaid court obligations

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 3:34 Defendant Zachary W. Mckusick in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM41 heard at this time. OSullivan: guilty to amended count #1 in 15CM41. Dismiss 15CM3. 2 years probation. available for expungement. Harrelson and Def agree.  Court goes over the Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form verbally with Def in court.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to the amended charge of Ct#1 (OSullivan will file an amended complaint): Harrelson stipulates to factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Count finds and adjudicates Def guilty of amended Ct#1. Dismisses 15CM3. OSullivan and Harrelson address sentencing. Court: S/W 2 years based on it being a domestic situation: conditions: court costs and expungement upon successful completion of probation.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

2:21 p.m.  Defendant Zachary W. Mckusick in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan addresses Counts 2 and 3.  Moves to dismiss 3.  Court grants motion to dismiss count 3.  Atty. Harrelson addresses the court regarding Count 2.  O'Sullivan addresses the court regarding Count 2.  Off the record at 2:26 p.m. Back on the record at 2:30 p.m.  Court dismisses Count 2, O'Sullivan has the right to refile amended complaint.
